description.narrative: The programme was suspended in May 2017 due to suspected irregularities. These irregularities wre substantiated in a forensic audit and Sida decided to end the programme, since the findings pointed to Hivos staff members and showed weaknesses in oversight and follow up by Hivos. Some of the activities implemeted before the suspension of the programme may have resulted in more long lasting relationships promoting civic engagement and voice. These include trainings of MPs in gender mainstreaming and of district councillors on gender responsive budgeting. It also includes two petitions by one of the implementing partners, challenging the constitutionality of the Uganda Communications Act, Internet shutdowns and the Anti-Terrorism Act, which have been won. A baseline study on perceptions of freedom of expression will also be useful for future use.The overall results are howerver very weak. After refunding the funds that were misused, Hivos remained with a large programme budget. After finalising the close out audit, Sida asked Hivos to pay back the remaining balance. Sida received the repayment on 3 July 2019.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
